ruleset.name: Import Statements
ruleset.description: These rules deal with different problems that can occur with import statements.

rule.name: DuplicateImports
rule.description: Duplicate or overlapping import statements should be avoided.

rule.name: DontImportJavaLang
rule.message: Avoid importing anything from the package 'java.lang'
rule.description: Avoid importing anything from the package 'java.lang'. These classes are automatically imported (JLS 7.5.3).

rule.name: UnusedImports
rule.description: Avoid the use of unused import statements to prevent unwanted dependencies.

rule.name: ImportFromSamePackage
rule.message: No need to import a type that lives in the same package
rule.description: There is no need to import a type that lives in the same package.

rule.name: TooManyStaticImports
rule.message: Too many static imports may lead to messy code
rule.description: If you overuse the static import feature, it can make your program unreadable and unmaintainable, polluting its namespace with all the static members you import. Readers of your code (including you, a few months after you wrote it) will not know which class a static member comes from (Sun 1.5 Language Guide).

property.name: maximumStaticImports
property.description: All static imports can be disallowed by setting this to 0

rule.name: UnnecessaryFullyQualifiedName
rule.message: Unnecessary use of fully qualified name ''{0}'' due to existing {2}import ''{1}''
rule.description: Import statements allow the use of non-fully qualified names. The use of a fully qualified name which is covered by an import statement is redundant. Consider using the non-fully qualified name.
